description: Notes on basic network devices and their functions.

content.question: What is a network?
content.answer: A computer network is a digital telecommunication network which allows nodes to share connections. A network allows nodes to share resources.

content.question: What is a client?
content.answer: A client is a device that accesses a service made available by a server.

content.question: What is a server?
content.answer: A server is a device that provides functions or services for clients.

sections.title: Switch
content: You don’t connect end hosts like PCs or Servers directly to each other, you aggregate the connections to a device called Switch.
Switch have lots of interfaces for you to connect end hosts to.
Switch is used to forward traffic within a LAN (Local Area Network).
PC1 and PC2 that are connected to Switch1 can send data to each other via the switch; however, these switches cannot connect directly to the internet.
Switches have many network interfaces/ports for end hosts to connect to (usually 24+).
Do not provide connectivity between LANs or over the internet.

sections.title: Router
content: Have fewer network interfaces than switches.
Are used to provide connectivity between different LANs.
Are therefore used to send data over the internet.

sections.title: Firewall
content: Specialty network security devices that control network traffic entering and exiting your network.
Monitor and control network traffic based on configured rules.
Can be placed ‘inside’ the network or ‘outside the network’. Meaning the firewall can filter traffic before it reaches the router or after it has passed through the router.
Are known as ‘Next-generation Firewalls’ when they include more modern and advanced filtering capabilities.

sections.title: Network Firewall
content: Are hardware devices that filter traffic between networks.

sections.title: Host-Based Firewall
content: Are software applications that filter traffic entering and exiting a host machine, like a PC.
